intro: Sarcanthus elongatus, commonly known as the long-stemmed sarcanthus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many species with showy, tubular flowers. The plant is characterized by its elongated stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Sarcanthus elongatus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
